document.masterDocTitle: Turritellidae (Gastropoda) of the Miocene Paratethys Sea with considerations about turritellid genera

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. The Deshayes collection, which was part of the ‘Ecole des Mines Collection’, is stored at the Université Claude Bernard since 1978. Seven syntypes of
Vermetus milleti
are glued on a label; the syntype illustrated by Deshayes (1850) has the inventory number UCBL-EM 32115.

Studied material.
2 spec. NHMW 1856/0035/0193, Steinebrunn ( Austria ), syntypes of
Vermetus carinatus Hörnes, 1856
, 1 spec. NHMW 1876/0011/0077,
1 spec. NHMW 2016/0177/0350,
Lăpugiu de Sus
( Romania )
.

Illustrated material. Figs 29A
1 –A
2
: NHMW 1856/0035/0193, SL: 22.9 mm , MD: 16.1 mm , Steinebrunn ( Austria ), syntype of
Vermetus carinatus Hörnes
, illustrated in Hörnes (1856, pl. 46, fig. 17); Figs 29B
1 –B
2
: NHMW 1856/0035/0193, SL: 17.5 mm , MD: 10.6 mm , Steinebrunn ( Austria ), syntype of
Vermetus carinatus Hörnes
; Fig. 29C : NHMW 1876/0011/0077, SL: 13.7 mm , MD: 8.5 mm , Lăpugiu de Sus ( Romania ), syntype of
Vermetus carinatus Hörnes.

Discussion. Bałuk (1975 , 2006 ) and
Landau et al . (2004
, 2018) described this species in detail. Most Paratethyan specimens are characterized by two prominent keel-like spiral cords on early teleoconch whorls, resulting in an
Archimediella
-like appearance. Specimens with three spiral cords and a weak adapical spiral cord are present as well. Therefore, we agree with Bałuk (1975 , 2006 ) and
Landau et al . (2004)
in synonymizing the Paratethyan
Vermetus carinatus Hörnes 1856
[non Quoy & Gaimard 1834 ] and
Vermetus ( Vermicularia ) pseudoturritella Boettger, 1907
with
Vermicularia milleti ( Deshayes, 1850 )
.

Paleoecology.
Saint Martin et al. (2000)
mention the species from a Badenian micriobialitic coral reef in Hungary . Other occurrences from Korytnica ( Poland ), Steinebrunn ( Austria ) and Estepona ( Spain ) are not reef-associated but represent various clayey to sandy inner to middle neritic environments.
